How?

I decided to go with Jekyll as the tool for creating this website. It just seemed like a fairly straightforward way to go about this. Jeykyll is not that hard to set up, even for me who has an extremely limited background in HTML. Again, I need to thank Joel as I referenced a lot of his code and learned a lot about Jekyll trough poking around.

If you want to set up your own Jekyll blog, you are able to host it on GitHub pages. Personally, im running it on a pertty compitent Linode for $5/mo. Jekyll has a pretty good tutorial for a basic setup and to get your bearings.
